case_vignette: A 70-year-old man is at his dermatologist’s office for the treatment of a severely pruritic erythroderma with scaling on his buttocks that has been slowly progressing over the past two weeks. The patient works as a truck driver and has a history of hypertension treated with enalapril. The patient reports having tried an over-the-counter cream on the rash without improvement. The vital signs are within normal range. On physical exam, he has multiple confluent and well-demarcated pink patches on his buttocks and legs with some scaling and enlarged inguinal lymph nodes. The dermatologist orders a skin biopsy that reveals Pautrier microabscesses.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a very itchy and spreading red rash with flaky skin on my buttocks that has been getting worse over the past two weeks.
Have you noticed the rash anywhere else on your body?
Yes, I also have pink patches with some scaling on my legs.
Are the borders of these patches well-defined and do they have a ring-like appearance?
The edges of the patches are clear and well-defined.
Have you experienced similar skin issues in the past?
No, this is new for me.
Do you have any known allergies or a history of skin conditions like eczema or psoriasis in your family?
I don't have any known allergies or a family history of skin conditions like eczema or psoriasis.
Have you recently started any new medications, or have you been in contact with any new soaps, detergents, or personal care products?
No, I haven't started any new medications or been in contact with new soaps, detergents, or personal care products.
Have you been exposed to anyone with a similar rash, or have you spent time in environments such as locker rooms, swimming pools, or similar areas where fungal infections are more common?
No, I haven't been exposed to anyone with a similar rash or spent time in such environments.
Do you have any other symptoms such as fever, joint pains, or malaise?
No, I don't have any other symptoms like fever, joint pains, or malaise.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 70-year-old man.
Final Diagnosis: Tinea corporis (ringworm)
